text:
1162-66 Flatbush Avenue, adjoining the S.W. corner of Dorchester Road, showing the Suydam-Ditmars House, built about 1700 and torn down in 1911. Hendrick Suydam, born in 1732, purchased the farm in 1759 from the heirs of Jacobus Lott. The house was owned by the Ditmars family until 1909. John Ditmars, son-in-law of Capt. Andrew Suydam, was the first Ditmars owner.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

About 1898
Views 1,2

1162-66 Flatbush Avenue, adjoining the S.W. corner of Dorchester Road, showing the Suydam-Ditmars House, built about 1700 and torn down in 1911. Hendrick Suydam, born in 1732, purchased the farm in 1759 from the heirs of Jacobus Lott. The house was owned by the Ditmars family until 1909. John Ditmars, son-in-law of Capt. Andrew Suydam, was the first Ditmars owner.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

About 1898
Views 1,2

(1)
Flatbush Ave., east side, between Clarendon Road and Ave. D., showing the Cap't Cornelius Vanderveer house, also known as the Flag house. (Cap't Vanderveer was born in 1731; in the old house built by his father on this site, and it was upon this site in 1787, that the present house was built by the Captain. It was demolished in 1911. It stood south of Vanderveer Place, in 1880, and in Vanderveer Place in 1908, and No. 1159, where it is supposed to have stood is just north of
the same street.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing barns on the right at the rear of the house.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
